stories.text:
I've read designing data intensive systems and it covered distributed systems a bit.

I don't find most textbooks to be an actually good intro outside of a course setting. For example, I own Andrew Tannenbaum's Distributed System book and a few others of his. But his writing style is too dense for me to make enough progress without giving up.

What other books (probably not textbooks) do you recommend on distributed systems?
stories.title: Ask HN: Best books on modern distributed systems
Corelight secures $75M Series D to bolster its network defense offering
The Australian federal government is planning to de-anonymize the internet

stories.text:
Hi guys!

Almost all of us want to have a lot of followers or a personal brand-led community. And the purpose is not ego or "to feel more confident" - your community is the best what you can build for your earns and business. That's why we have the rise of the creator economy.

And almost all of us started to create and share content but can't bring ourselves to do it consistently.

My question is "why"? What's the biggest obstacle or the most challenging part of community/audience building for you?

Share in the comments, please!
stories.title: Why you can't bring yourself to create content consistently?
To Those Impacted by the War in Afghanistan, You Are Not Alone
